page.title: 19Transport, Murroes area
page.content:
The remains of the{railway}from Broughty Ferry to Forfar, with a station at Gagie, just SW of Wellbank, can still be seen. But the passenger service ceased in the 1950's with the last goods train running in 1965.
Later, the area was served by{buses}travelling from Dundee to Forfar or Kirriemuir. Nowadays a small number of buses still pass through Westhall Tce, but the service from Wellbank to Forfar has been discontinued, and has been replaced by 4 buses each day providing a circular route via Kellas or Monikie to Dundee.
{ Road haulage}in the area is catered for by Norman Jamieson and Scotts of Claverhouse, both based at Westhall Terrace.
